metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7304 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Canonical snapd before version 2.37.1 incorrectly performed socket owner validation, allowing an attacker to run arbitrary commands as root. This issue affects: Canonical snapd versions prior to 2.37.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.34.2ubuntu0.1
snapd - 2.34.2ubuntu0.1
snapd-xdg-open - 2.34.2ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.34.2ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.34.2ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-snappy - 2.34.2ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.34.2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> introduced in https://github.com/snapcore/snapd/pull/4626 original CRD was 2019-02-06 16:00:00 UTC but delayed due to delayed Fedora update

criterions.comment: snapd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.2ubuntu0.1').
